            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The Woodstock First Nation Climate Monitoring Program aims to continuously sample the streams and lakes of our elders before us and those who surround the Wolisataquey territory for safe fishing and swimming. The sampling is conducted by portable sensors that lay just below the water’s surface and sends the data to a device in which the data can be saved and reviewed.  
The team of the Woodstock First Nation Climate Monitoring Program also promotes and encourages both youth and elders to play an active role in our project and to understand the importance of monitoring the health of our waters surrounding us.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-5ff8-0e09
notes:
The Woodstock First Nation Climate Monitoring Program aims to continuously sample the streams and lakes of our elders before us and those who surround the Wolisataquey territory for safe fishing and swimming. The sampling is conducted by portable sensors that lay just below the water’s surface and sends the data to a device in which the data can be saved and reviewed.  
The team of the Woodstock First Nation Climate Monitoring Program also promotes and encourages both youth and elders to play an active role in our project and to understand the importance of monitoring the health of our waters surrounding us.

notes_translated.en:
The Woodstock First Nation Climate Monitoring Program aims to continuously sample the streams and lakes of our elders before us and those who surround the Wolisataquey territory for safe fishing and swimming. The sampling is conducted by portable sensors that lay just below the water’s surface and sends the data to a device in which the data can be saved and reviewed.  
The team of the Woodstock First Nation Climate Monitoring Program also promotes and encourages both youth and elders to play an active role in our project and to understand the importance of monitoring the health of our waters surrounding us.
notes_translated.fr:
Le programme de surveillance du climat de la Première nation de Woodstock vise à échantillonner en permanence les cours d'eau et les lacs de nos aînés avant nous et de ceux qui entourent le territoire de Wolisataquey afin de pêcher et de nager en toute sécurité. L'échantillonnage est effectué par des capteurs portables placés juste en dessous de la surface de l'eau et envoient les données à un appareil dans lequel les données peuvent être enregistrées et examinées. 
L'équipe du programme de surveillance du climat de la Première nation de Woodstock encourage également les jeunes et les personnes âgées à jouer un rôle actif dans notre projet et à comprendre l'importance de surveiller la santé des eaux qui nous entourent.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: Woodstock First Nation Climate Monitoring Program

title_translated.fr: Programme de surveillance du climat de la Première nation de Woodstock
